We want our customers to only think about the design, the story behind, the wearability, and most importantly whether this piece really makes you glow.

We carefully select the most affordable precious metal sterling silver, in its best quality, and plated it with 18K gold to give extra shine and durability. It looks as gorgeous as 18K gold, but cost much less, giving you another reason to make yourself radiant.
Chalcedony is the main material we use in Be Aura collection. It is one of the natural gems known for gentle personality and stable magnetic energy. Chalcedony appears in various color naturally, which we hope can enlighten the energy of aura colors for wearers. Besides chalcedony, optically flawless cubic zirconia has been used to echo the aura glows.
Freshwater pearls are one of the most graceful, feminine and sophisticated material in jewelry design. We use it in Be Signature collection as the immaculate shine from it resembles the triumphant radiance we want to create in our design.
 

Risks & Challenges


Since the beginning of 2018, we have been working towards the launch. Same as any start-up companies, we face various risks and challenges along the road. We have poured our hearts into every single detail as we believe GLOD will glow.
One of the main challenges is how to actualize our design. Some of the pieces can be worn in multiple ways, some consists of kinetic and spinning parts and some are made of different color tones. All these design details need trial and error, and it took us longer time to modify and produce the best samples.
Another struggle is about the choice of materials. We never want to transfer the high material cost to the price that you are paying, thus we have used a lot of time, finding the best materials in terms of cost, color, and properties etc, to balance and present the design in its best aura.
Partnered with the best resources we have now, we expect the pieces to be ready and arrive in your hands during October – November 2018. If there are unforeseeable circumstances, whatever the case may be, you will hear it from us transparently with a solution.
 
Share with Us

We love to hear from you, so feel free to leave us some comments and likes on Facebook and Instagram.
https://www.instagram.com/glodjewelryhttps://www.facebook.com/glodjewelry
After you have received our products, please do take photos when wearing them and tag us with #glodjewelry #igniteyouraura, we will be so eager to see how they look on you, and how your aura glows.

story:
Hello! I’m Barbara, the founder of Kaiola. The idea was born as a result of a frustrated couple of years looking for a surf hat that would protect me from the blazing hot sun, blinding glares and water splashes I encountered in my surfing days.

All I could find were surf hats with clumsy design, poor materials and terrible style, so I decided to make my own. I’m a proudly bootstrapped entrepreneur and am relying on this fantastic community of crowdfunding backers to help me turn this project into a reality. We are ready to launch production. So thank you in advance for your interest!

If you want to contribute there are 2 ways: 

1. If you want to get a perk (get something in return for your contribution), they are all listed along the right hand side on the desktop, or, on mobile, they are conveniently located on the top. Of the perks we offer, not all of them include a surf hat so check them out and find what you are looking for. 

2. If you just want to support us, click the pink button "Back it" on the desktop at the top, or, on mobile, it's called "Make a Contribution" located at the end of the perks.

 

so let's get to it... will the Kaiola surf hat help my surfing game?

That's our aim! We might not realize it, but our confidence is totally impacted by the effects of the blazing hot sun, glares and water splashes in our eyes while surfing. By wearing our Kaiola surf hat, you will be protected from the sun and water elements, not to mention that you won't have to worry about burning eyes and blurred vision from sunblock migrating into your eyes. Special attention has been put on refining the fit, as well as having an incredibly strong signature chin strap to ensure your Kaiola surf hat doesn't fall off. We have thought of all the details - see a full overview below. And yes, it will withstand duck-diving and all kinds of wipe-outs. 

will I look cool wearing it?

Absolutely! We take style very seriously and put a lot of effort behind crafting a surf hat that looks cool in and out of the water. That's why we designed our signature chin strap to be nearly invisible and easily tucked away. Over the years we've tested our prototypes with several surfers and are happy to share that we've received a thumbs up from some really cool ones. 

let's get into the nuts & bolts of our surf hat

 

we love the ocean and nature

 

small to big, we've got you covered

find your perfect mate

we've spent hours doing the fun job... colour combinations! we've narrowed down from hundreds of options to our top 8 and are giving you the opportunity to buy one of these or, should you wish, you can choose your own colour combination. NOTE: No need to choose your colour now. If you purchase one or more Kaiola surf hats, we will reach out to you to collect your colour and size preference. 

 

want to know our entire journey?

 

a digital screensaver for those on-the-moooove

get this exclusive digital wallpaper for your mobile when you purchase a perk with VIP status

 

get to know a few faces of the team behind Kaiola

what would we do without a stellar team of passionate people who have helped us every step of the way? From the manufacturer to our creative team, none of this would be possible if it weren't for all the love poured on Kaiola. Thanks guys!

 

risks and challenges

we strongly believe that we have thought of every little detail and have outlined our product and our delivery timeline with great care. We have an amazing manufacturer and have strong ties with our suppliers, as we have tested all materials in depth and know exactly what we want. However, there are some risks and challenges that could come our way. This might, for example, be a supply chain issue, a manufacturing issue or a shipping issue. If such should arise, we will do our utmost to find a solution and are confident that we will deliver your products to you on time and in perfect shape!

If such should arise, we will do our utmost to find a solution and are confident that we will deliver your products to you on time and in perfect shape!

story:
My name is Quinton Arvin I am 16 year old aspiring fashion designer. I created a line called “deadly fashion,” because I believe my designs lay to rest what the average tee-shirt embodies. My line is for those who can think outside the box, say what’s on their mind. I have fun with words and images to help build confidence in both teens and adults. My shirts speak fashion and say ”look! yes I am different; and yes it’s ok to be different! I am Me!!”

By donating an amount of $50 or $100 or as much as you can spare. You will would be sponsoring my dream and assisting me with the Start-up cost I need to  begin my fashion career and independent business venture. Again, any donation is appreciated, and I know that I can count on you to support me.

story:
Welcome!

My name is Patricia Freeman, Founder and Head Designer of Denim Blu. With your help,  I'm designing a new collection for women with curvier figures. The collection is named "BEAUTIFUL YOU". The Inspiration is the 1920's-30's Era. (The Great Gatspy/Roaring 20's with a modern chic flair of course!

My goal is to launch this trendy and much needed collection for women, show the line in New York at Fashion Week and also donate a percentage of the donations to benefit a charity.   Our goal is $50,000+ however; we’re setting our “Indiegogo” goal at $25,000 because if we don’t reach our target, Indiegogo will take a much larger service fee.

On our 2013 Collection campaigns is to bring awareness to our charity causes in an effort to raise money for awareness and programs to educate the public. This year the causes we are supporting with our campaign will be TIGERLILY FOUNDATION & UCAP. Our home page is a video of: Maimah Karma, founder of TigerLily, discussing services TigerLily Foundation offers, breast cancer support, education and advocacy  for women ages 15-40.

During this campaign we will post video, sketches and final product to up date you on our progress. They will be located in this home page and gallery page....Enjoy! (SKETCHES will be located at the GALLERY TAB)

Why Denim Blu?

We see that for women with curvier figures, the choices are very slim as far as clothing choices. It's a market that is untapped and looking for designers such as myself willing to make trendy, beautiful and classy clothing for women of ALL shapes and sizes.

After years of my own weight fluctuation, search for clothing that fit appropriately and hearing women state their desire more clothing choices, I thought maybe alot of other women feel like I do. So, I decided to do something about it.

I then started creating clothing that would fit women of all shapes and sizes appropriately AND it's trendy at the same time. No sagging in funny places and no unusual tightness in other places that should fit.

I've found a way have the samples made but the set back is to financially pay to produce and market the collection. I have all the right interns, factory and other professionals in place and would like to bring "BEAUTIFUL YOU" to the world.

With your help we can:

  • Give 10% of our campaign fund to charity.
  • Produce first samples of 20 new looks for the collection
  • Website and marketing
  • Event fees and show the collection in New York during fashion week in February 2013
  • Buy material, supplies, fabric for samples and final production.
  • Professional Photography and look books for my line (a catalog for buyers if you will)
  • Purchase necessary machines and dress forms: 1 straight stitch machine, 1 serger, 2 dress forms, a cutting table
  • Launch event
  • Hire my interns so that they can be paid employees!

The Perks:

For everyone that contributes to this campaign I will give you something back. The perks range from a hand written note card and autographed illustration. Other rewards include a garment from the collection, special accessories, Denim Blu Tote or T-Shirt and Clutch bag. Everyone will of course receive a giant hug!!

If we do not reach our entire goal we will adjust the number of garments we make, for example instead of doing 20 new styles for our collection we will do 15.

The Impact

With each contribution you will not only help launch our new collection and get a fun sexy reward-you will also help support my mission of giving to charity organizations that support the causes we love....children with disabilities, breast/cervical cancer, disadvantaged and at risk families, heart disease and abuse. 10% of our profits our 2013 campaigns will go to  the TIGERLILY FOUNDATION (Breast Cancer Awareness) and UCAP (United Communities Against Poverty). Links to both 501c3 designated organizations are listed below:

TIGERLILY FOUNDATION:

http://www.tigerlilyfoundation.org

http://www.tigerlilyfoundation.org/Tigerlily%20Foundation%20Brochure_2009.pdf

UNITED COMMUNITIES AGAINST POVERTY (UCAP)

http://www.ucappgc.org/about.html

________________________________________________________

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Our goal is $50,000+ however; we’re setting our “Indiegogo” goal at $25,000 because if we don’t reach our target, Indiegogo will take a much larger service fee.  I'm very excited for this project and know that it will be successful with your help. I am always amazed by the support of my friends, family and other colleagues. You would be amazed at how a little support from each person can have a huge impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our task we're taking on is huge and with your help we can make it. Just in case you can't contribute there are still ways you can help out:

  • You can simply  make some noise about the campaign.
  • You can host a pledge night at your house.
  • You can choose to be a "sponsor" for the campaign. Not just donation of funds but you can donate your expertise in a certain field (photography, marketing & ect)...to help cut down cost just in case we don't make our goal
  • Donate some free time you have to help make some rewards.
  • SHARE SHARE SHARE on all Social Media pages you have to all your friends. This will encourage your friends to donate and/or share!

I am always amazed by the support of my friends, family and other colleagues. You would be amazed at how a little support from each person can have a huge impact.


Other Ways You Can Help
Our task we're taking on is huge and with your help we can make it. Just in case you can't contribute there are still ways you can help out:


You can simply  make some noise about the campaign.
You can host a pledge night at your house.
You can choose to be a "sponsor" for the campaign. Not just donation of funds but you can donate your expertise in a certain field (photography, marketing & ect)...to help cut down cost just in case we don't make our goal
Donate some free time you have to help make some rewards.

SHARE SHARE SHARE on all Social Media pages you have to all your friends. This will encourage your friends to donate and/or share!

story:
We're going to print brand new T-shirts! 

Who's this "Cutman"?

My name is Chris, but everyone calls me Cutman. I DJ chiptunes and video game music, and run a record label called GameChops. We produce, license and distrbute high quality video game remixes! Some of you may know me from PAX, Otakon, or MAGFest.

What We Need & What You Get

We've already got the art and the printer lined up. We need money to buy blank shirts and start the printing process. We're using IndieGoGo so anyone who has ever wanted a shirt can get one hot off the presses, in whatever size they want!

All T-Shirts available in Black, White, Red, and Gray!

Perks include two different shirt designs, as well as Dj CUTMAN stickers and the collectable GameChops albums featured in our Merch Store! Check out our perks, we've got some awesome stuff and great value!

If We Exceed Our Goal

We've got some awesome ideas for additional perks if we exceed our goal. If we exceed our goal, all tiers at $60 and higher will get stuff like:

  • $600 - Oversized GameChops stickers
  • $700 - GameChops and Dj CUTMAN Buttons
  • $800 - Special edition Dj CUTMAN Stickers 
  • $1000 - Special edition Snapback hats

 

The Impact

 

Everyone gets their own made-to-order T-Shirt!

But that's not all. If we raise additional money, we will use it to hire artists to create album art for our releases that are not currently available as a CD. This will both help GameChops grow as a label, and produce a sweet new product that never existed before! The Album Producer perk gives a special supporter the ability to choose what album gets printed next!

GameChops is the first record label to focus on licensed, high-quality video game dance music. Supporting us by contributing to this IndieGoGo and wearing our shirts is worth so much. Every little bit helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're unable to help us get shirts made, you can still help:

  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo Share tools!
  • Like Dj CUTMAN and GameChops on facebook!
  • Follow @VideoGameDJ and @GameChops on twitter!

Thanks for checking out this campaign!

story:
Who we are / What we do

LOACULT is a young brand from germany. Inspired by nature, the mechanical watchscene and fashion. The LOACULT atelier is located on the verge of the palatinate forest in south - west germany. we use finest materials from all over the world to create uniqe and exclusive bracelets - all by hand.

Why we need your support

LOACULT goes fashion and we need your support!
We want to drop our first exclusive t-shirt collection and
we want to broaden the range of accessories!
With this campaign we want to ask for your support
If you have any questions - feel free to ask

story:
At The Gonq press, we will use the innovation of on-demand printers, with their convenience, immediacy, and customizability, and enhance it with the beauty and tradition of letterpress.

We propose to lease an on-demand book printer—an all-in-one printing, cutting, and binding unit that produces a perfect, store-quality bound paperback book in a matter of minutes—in order to release curated series of public domain works with beautifully designed letterpress covers from Toronto's own Any Key Press. The machine will also be run as a small press for the public, as well as being used to help organizations that we believe in, such as Story Planet and the Toronto Public Library Foundation.

A book's cover doesn't change the quality of the contents, but all of us here at the Gonq feel that, with the sheer number of books in teetering stacks around our respective homes, they also end up making up a huge chunk of your everyday visual landscape.  Why not like looking at them too?


(*update: here's a handy-dandy infographic to better understand the Gonq Press!)

In Canada, a “work” (in our case, a book) becomes freely available for anyone to use once the creator has been dead for at least 50 years. This means that the works of any writer who died before 1964 are fair game and anyone can create new editions of them or produce copies. Everyone from William Shakespeare to Ernest Hemingway is in the public domain!

Rebecca Andoff has been in retail management for nearly a decade, including two years spent in bookstores.  She has spent the last three years developing and refining a detailed business plan for The Algonquin Bookshop and The Gonq Press.  In 2012, Beck started a daily book blog (now on hiatus) dedicated to demystifying and appreciating the literary world—exactly the values that The Algonquin will be built upon.  She is currently the Social Enterprise Manager at Story Planet, a children's literacy charity in Toronto's Bloordale neighbourhood.  Story Planet is a non-profit storymaking centre that offers free workshops for kids and teens, ranging from after school homework help to teen filmmaking.

The rest of the Gonq team is made up of a crew of four with extensive experience in graphic design, illustration, social media marketing, small business bookkeeping, and a combined 17+ years in book retail.


The Gonq is one piece of the Algonquin Bookshop.  The Algonquin is a new store we aim to open in Toronto later this year featuring a fully licensed cafe and event space. In the last little while a lot of attention has turned to a slew of bookstores closing across town, much to the dismay of readers, but we offer a modern, evolving business model: a store with customer service, ambience, convenience, and community involvement that will set a whole new standard in book retail. The Algonquin will be a cozy, friendly, well-curated shop staffed by experts of all stripes, with damn good coffee, beer, and wine, which also provides options for online shopping and easy home delivery. But the key to its ongoing success will be The Gonq, our on-demand printer. This printer allows us the freedom to not have to pre-pay for and store hundreds of classic titles, but rather produce them as needed—no wasted storage space, no shipping fees, and a significantly reduced initial investment, all of which allows us to bring in a wider range of contemporary titles and interesting gift options.

We are asking for $20,000. This is enough to lease and run the machine for over six months, expand the series we produce (including working with more amazing illustrators and designers), and get your books to you.  Any money we raise, and especially the number of people who help fund our campaign, will be a show of support that helps us also get more traditional funding to open the shop.

Why isn't this a crowdfunding campaign to open the bookstore?  Because we have such faith in the viability of our business plan, that there's no need to rely on donations.  The Gonq is a creative project, and we very much wanted it to be more like pre-purchasing product you genuinely love, rather than open-ended donation (as much as we appreciate that, too!)

If you're interested in making a repayable loan to the bookstore of an amount over $1000, firstly: thanks, pal! Secondly, please contact Beck at Rebecca.Andoff@gmail.com and we can arrange a meeting to go over the business plan in greater detail.

We’ll be starting with two series of carefully chosen titles featuring exclusively designed letterpress covers printed by Toronto's Any Key Press:

The Blurred Line Between Fiction And Memoir


(Note: The are mock-ups. The final product will be paperback; details may vary.)

"Write what you know" is the first rule of fiction, but with these masters it is hard to tell what is really true and what is embellishment. The main question on our minds is, does that really matter?

  • My Lady Nicotine by J.M. Barrie
  • A Moveable Feast by Ernest Hemingway
  • The Egg And I by Betty MacDonald
  • Down And Out In Paris And London by George Orwell
  • Walden; or, Life In The Woods by Henry David Thoreau

The Lesser Works


(Note: These are mock-ups. The final product will be paperback; details may vary. Grey areas denote embossing.)

Each of these authors is known primarily for one or two major works, but this collection shows that even their oft-overlooked books contain strokes of genius.

  • The Beautiful And Damned by F. Scott Fitzgerald
  • Demian by Herman Hesse
  • Dubliners by James Joyce
  • Coming Up For Air by George Orwell
  • The Years by Virginia Woolf


And when we hit $10,000, we'll introduce our own set of...

C.S. Lewis' Complete Chronicles Of Narnia

  • The Magician’s Nephew
  • The Lion, The Witch, And The Wardrobe
  • The Horse And His Boy
  • Prince Caspian
  • The Voyage Of The Dawn Treader
  • The Silver Chair
  • The Last Battle

As a small press, we will be able to offer burgeoning writers an opportunity to have their work published, edited (if they so wish) and professionally bound on-demand. Despite the saying, people actually do judge books by their covers (our years in book retail can attest to that), and we provide a variety of eye-catching templates to create a distinct statement for your book to separate it from a sea of self-published books—no more Googled stock images needed. Any printing minimums are avoided as we are able to accommodate any number of copies, which makes it perfect for gifts or special editions. With the press being onsite at Algonquin Books, you’ll have a leg up with a place to showcase it and the team here actively pushing for its success.

"Isn't print a dying medium?" you ask? "Aren't bookstores closing all over?" That may be true in some cases (well, we know it is), but many sensationalized articles on this topic seem to overlook the fact that under the right set of circumstances, bookstores can thrive, moreso now than ever. Here is a great article from last month's New York Magazine about how six bookstores use very different tactics to set themselves apart from the rest (one major way many stores are doing that is by serving alcohol... we're on board with that!). The respected Toronto store Type (one of our absolute faves) used a viral video to gain international attention. This Esquire Culture Blog post on how to quit Amazon sums up the appeal that small bookstores still hold for many. And if your concern is with the looming dominance of e-books, not only are studies showing that their sales have plateaued, but many people are becoming frustrated that you don't even technically "own" the e-books you purchase. We have nothing against e-books (in fact, we all own e-readers ourselves), but as Stephen Fry wryly put it:



Every dollar donated will be used to fund The Gonq project, and we appreciate any amount you can give. To really help get the word out though, we need you to share this page with any booklovers you know. Not just the total amount of money raised but also the total number of donors will help us secure further funding through more traditional means. Literally every donation counts!

Thank you just for taking the time to check us out, and we hope to hear your feedback as time goes on!

Sincerely,
Team Gonq

“There are books full of great writing that don’t have very good stories. Read sometimes for the story… don’t be like the book-snobs who won’t do that. Read sometimes for the words–the language. Don’t be like the play-it-safers who won’t do that. But when you find a book that has both a good story and good words, treasure that book.” ― Stephen King
story_txt:
At The Gonq press, we will use the innovation of on-demand printers, with their convenience, immediacy, and customizability, and enhance it with the beauty and tradition of letterpress.We propose to lease an on-demand book printer—an all-in-one printing, cutting, and binding unit that produces a perfect, store-quality bound paperback book in a matter of minutes—in order to release curated series of public domain works with beautifully designed letterpress covers from Toronto's own Any Key Press. The machine will also be run as a small press for the public, as well as being used to help organizations that we believe in, such as Story Planet and the Toronto Public Library Foundation.A book's cover doesn't change the quality of the contents, but all of us here at the Gonq feel that, with the sheer number of books in teetering stacks around our respective homes, they also end up making up a huge chunk of your everyday visual landscape.  Why not like looking at them too?(*update: here's a handy-dandy infographic to better understand the Gonq Press!)In Canada, a “work” (in our case, a book) becomes freely available for anyone to use once the creator has been dead for at least 50 years. This means that the works of any writer who died before 1964 are fair game and anyone can create new editions of them or produce copies. Everyone from William Shakespeare to Ernest Hemingway is in the public domain!Rebecca Andoff has been in retail management for nearly a decade, including two years spent in bookstores.  She has spent the last three years developing and refining a detailed business plan for The Algonquin Bookshop and The Gonq Press.  In 2012, Beck started a daily book blog (now on hiatus) dedicated to demystifying and appreciating the literary world—exactly the values that The Algonquin will be built upon.  She is currently the Social Enterprise Manager at Story Planet, a children's literacy charity in Toronto's Bloordale neighbourhood.  Story Planet is a non-profit storymaking centre that offers free workshops for kids and teens, ranging from after school homework help to teen filmmaking.The rest of the Gonq team is made up of a crew of four with extensive experience in graphic design, illustration, social media marketing, small business bookkeeping, and a combined 17+ years in book retail.The Gonq is one piece of the Algonquin Bookshop.  The Algonquin is a new store we aim to open in Toronto later this year featuring a fully licensed cafe and event space. In the last little while a lot of attention has turned to a slew of bookstores closing across town, much to the dismay of readers, but we offer a modern, evolving business model: a store with customer service, ambience, convenience, and community involvement that will set a whole new standard in book retail. The Algonquin will be a cozy, friendly, well-curated shop staffed by experts of all stripes, with damn good coffee, beer, and wine, which also provides options for online shopping and easy home delivery. But the key to its ongoing success will be The Gonq, our on-demand printer. This printer allows us the freedom to not have to pre-pay for and store hundreds of classic titles, but rather produce them as needed—no wasted storage space, no shipping fees, and a significantly reduced initial investment, all of which allows us to bring in a wider range of contemporary titles and interesting gift options.We are asking for $20,000. This is enough to lease and run the machine for over six months, expand the series we produce (including working with more amazing illustrators and designers), and get your books to you.  Any money we raise, and especially the number of people who help fund our campaign, will be a show of support that helps us also get more traditional funding to open the shop.Why isn't this a crowdfunding campaign to open the bookstore?  Because we have such faith in the viability of our business plan, that there's no need to rely on donations.  The Gonq is a creative project, and we very much wanted it to be more like pre-purchasing product you genuinely love, rather than open-ended donation (as much as we appreciate that, too!)If you're interested in making a repayable loan to the bookstore of an amount over $1000, firstly: thanks, pal! Secondly, please contact Beck at Rebecca.Andoff@gmail.com and we can arrange a meeting to go over the business plan in greater detail.We’ll be starting with two series of carefully chosen titles featuring exclusively designed letterpress covers printed by Toronto's Any Key Press:The Blurred Line Between Fiction And Memoir(Note: The are mock-ups. The final product will be paperback; details may vary.)"Write what you know" is the first rule of fiction, but with these masters it is hard to tell what is really true and what is embellishment. My Lady Nicotine by J.M. Barrie


A Moveable Feast by Ernest Hemingway


The Egg And I by Betty MacDonald


Down And Out In Paris And London by George Orwell


Walden; or, Life In The Woods by Henry David Thoreau

The Lesser Works(Note: These are mock-ups. The final product will be paperback; details may vary. Grey areas denote embossing.)Each of these authors is known primarily for one or two major works, but this collection shows that even their oft-overlooked books contain strokes of genius.

Demian by Herman Hesse


Dubliners by James Joyce


Coming Up For Air by George Orwell


The Years by Virginia Woolf

story:
*PLEASE NOTE: This campaign will receive all funds raised, and fulfill all perks even if it does not reach its goal. 

*International Contributions, please add $18 shipping + handling per kit

What Is Designher Kit?

Designher Kit is a carefully curated DIY Jewelry and Accessory subscription kit, which takes the chore out of crafting. We deliver inspiration and supplies to your door every month, and save you from shopping for endless supplies. We source the most unique materials at the best prices to save you from the inevitable overspend on supplies you'll never use. So sit back, relax, and create!

PS: Not only is Designher Kit available in Canada, it's based in Toronto, and ships free anywhere in Canada!


What's In The Kit?

When you subscribe to Designher Kit, you’ll get a glam package in the mail each month! It will include 3 (4 for Indiegogo pledgers!) carefully curated jewelry and accessory projects, plus all the supplies and instructions to make them at home! 

Our team of designers scour the latest trends in order to create the best possible kits filled with wearable, and polished pieces you will be excited to create and proud to show off!


What's In The DIY Starter Kit?

The DIY Starter Kit includes the following:

  • x1 needle-nose plier
  • x1 flat-nose plier
  • x1 round-nose plier
  • x1 wire cutter plier
  • x1 glue gun
  • x2 glue gun sticks
  • x1 thread nipper

The DIY Starter Kit is free for a limited time with specific perks. Or you can add the discounted "DIY Starter Kit" perk to any of our other perks, listed to the right. *Multiple perks must be pledged in separate transactions.


Who We Are

In the Spring of 2012, and at only 26 years old, entrepreneur Dara Frydman launched Designher Co. out of a passion for all things handmade, beautiful and practical. The stylish studio in Toronto, Canada, offers an antidote to macaroni necklaces with chic DIY classes, camps and parties.

Dara Frydman also owns dara dot designs, a handmade fashion scarf business, which earned her a coveted spot at The One of a Kind Show in Toronto.

She recently became the host of Coral TVs specialty craft show, DIY with Designher Co.

Searching for a way to spread the DIY love, Designher Kit was launched in 2013 to deliver gleaming metallic envelopes filled with inspiration, project supplies, and treasures to the masses.

All this couldn't be possible without the creativity and support of the rest of our team (listed at the bottom of the screen)- thank you!!


What We Need

$3800 | Raw Materials { kit contents, packaging, print material }

$3000 | Website Expansion { design, coding, photography, videography }

$400   | Business and office expenses { fees, 800 phone line, office supplies }

$800   | Staff { administrative assistance, production }

$1000 | Marketing { press kits, AdWords, social media, contests, etc. }

= $9,000

Campaign funds raised in excess of the initial $9,000 will be used towards marketing initiatives, staff increase, warehouse space, and of course top-notch jewelry supplies to help make the kits (even more) Ah-mazing :)

* The first $500 raised in excess of our goal, will go towards teaching Dara to be less awkward on camera. Just kidding. Sort of.


What will you get if you pledge?

Pledge the Designher Kit campaign, and you have access to choose the perk(s) that are best for you! Be the first to receive this amazing kit, as subsequent subscribers may be subject to a waiting list.

In addition to these perks, we will be sending along a blank holiday card, so that you can easily gift your perk to a friend... Or even write yourself a lovely note. Heck, you deserve it :)

DIY Starter Kits will ship by December 1st, 2013 (unless otherwise noted in perk detail).

Once the campaign ends, we will contact you for your preference of gold-toned or silver-toned jewels (or a mix), and any other information we might need to complete your order. Our goal is to ship premier Designher Kits by January 20th 2014. 


Other Ways To Help Out

Please help spread the word by sharing our campaign on the social networks of your choice! We can help make that easy... check out our social share links below! Don't forget to tag your posts #DesignherKit. Thank you! 


FAQs

ABOUT DESIGNHER KIT

q: I just signed up for Designher Kit! Now what? 
a: When you receive your collection, simply come to designherkit.com and we’ll show you how to complete each project in a few simple steps. Don’t forget to share what you’re making! #designherkit

q: Will I know ahead of time what I’ll be getting? 
a: Nope, part of the fun is in the surprise! What we can promise, is that our designers scour all the latest trends to bring stylish and wearable pieces to your door every month. If you have ideas of what you’d like to see in future kits, please share with us via email, on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest!

q: Can I customize my kit? 
a: When you purchase your subscription you will be asked whether you prefer gold or silver toned jewelry. We will do our best to accommodate your preference each month! Down the road, we plan to customize further, offering kits for either the classic or trendy Designher gal.

q: What tools will I need to complete the projects in my kit? 
a: Most projects will require some or all jewelry pliers (needle nose, round nose, wire cutters), scissors, glue gun, needle and thread. We sell a DIY Starter Kit for only $29 + shipping ($5 in Canada, $10 in the USA). **Available as one of our perks for only $26 (shipping and tax included!) --->

q: How will I know how to create my new pieces? 
a: Each kit contains a postcard with pictures of the finished projects in the current collection. Log on to designherkit.com for simple instructions on how to create the pieces in your kit, or interpret the design and make it your own!

**For shipping and billing q & a, please check out the FAQ's on designherkit.com


CONTACT US
Have a question not answered here? Email us at info@designherkit.com
If you’re a member of the media and want to get in touch with us, email us at info@designherkit.com

story:
English version down below

 

You don't take a photograph, you make it.
Ansel Adams

 

Mi nombre es Ricardo Álvarez, soy un fotógrafo con más de 20 años de trabajo principalmente en el área de la creación artística y ocasionalmente como fotógrafo deportivo.

Combino mi pasión por la imagen con el gusto por dar clases, soy, desde hace más de 15 años profesor de lengua y también de fotografía.

Hay dos formas en las que hago fotografías, una implica crear los escenarios e incluir los elementos que tengo en mi cabeza, otra, es salir a buscar las imágenes que tengan algo en común y que puedan formar parte de una serie.

Y aquí entra mi petición. Siento que mi producción se ha estancado un poco, quiero alcanzar mejores resultados, quiero hacer un trabajo más detallado y más pulido y en este proceso contar con una impresora de buena calidad  a mi entera disposición (no tener que ir y venir a la tienda fotográfica) haría una gran diferencia.

A pesar de preferir el formato digital creo firmemente que todo lo que Ansel Adams dice y el cuidado que recomienda en el proceso de la impresión siguen y seguirán siendo válidos y por tanto me gusta seguir sus consejos (obras como The Print sigue siendo un clásico para los fotógrafos) por lo que tener control completo del proceso es importante para conseguir los mejores resultados.

¿Te gustaría ayudar a un fotógrafo preocupado por la calidad y el detalle a dar el siguiente salto?¿Te gustaría ser partícipe del rumbo que tomen mis siguientes colecciones de imágenes? Sigue leyendo, eso será ya un gran avance y si te es posible contribuye con mi causa.

Conozcan a la dama de mis sueños

Epson Stylus® Photo R3000 , me interesa esta impresora por su alta calidad y facilidad de manejo; además es fácil trabajar con papeles de algodón y otras texturas que mejoran de manera dramática el resultado.

Pero ahora bien, la impresora se puede conseguir en 640 dólares ¿y el resto? Bienvenidos al mundo del TLC, esta impresora en México tiene un costo cercano a los 15 mil pesos , algo así como 1,200 dólares… por impuestos y la garantía en el país… triste realidad…

El resto del dinero lo emplearía en comprar papel de algodón cuyo precio en tamaños de 13 pulgadas (paquetes de 25 hojas)  es de aproximadamente 1 800 pesos (varía dependiendo de las marcas que pueda conseguir),  unos 150 dólares.

Qué te ofrezco:

1.  Mi más profundo y sincero agradecimiento,

2.  Mi dedicación a propiciar que más gente conozca qué es un proceso creativo, cómo nace una obra con pretensiones artísticas. Creo que el arte no tiene que ver con el precio de una obras, si no con su contenido, con  su relación con el espectador y con la totalidad del proceso en su creación y su “historia” de vida, eso es lo que para mí hace del arte algo fascinante y estoy dispuesto a compartirlo con todo aquel que esté dispuesto a escuchar. Al final, citando nuevamente a Adams “Siempre hay dos personaes en una fotografía: el fotógrafo y el espectador".

3. Compartir contigo algo de lo que como fotógrafo he aprendido, crearé un blog dirigido a principiantes y a personas con bajo presupuesto, pero con amor e interés por la fotografía.  (Consejos sobre cómo encontrar la cámara ideal, mejorar el uso de tu equipo y realizar ajustes básicos a tus imágenes; incluso, si hay interés; compartir mi visión sobre el trabajo de artistas de la lente que admiro, tanto de la vieja guardia como contemporáneos).

4. Finalmente, y lo que más nos emociona a quienes vivimos para esto, a partir de cierta cantidad (ver la lista de beneficios) estaré en posibilidades de enviarte una impresión de mi trabajo, con la mayor de las ilusiones de que la disfrutes y se convierta en algo valioso para ti.

Plantear este proyecto aquí me emociona pues por un lado me ayudará a lograr un avance en mi carrera, en mi proyecto de vida y por otro, lo que me emociona sobre manera, me permitirá establecer un mayor contacto con la gente, recibir opiniones, retroalimentación sobre lo que hago y sobre el proceso que sigo, creo en el arte que propugna por esto y quiero seguir este camino. Te invito a participar.

¿Y si no tienes dinero?

¿Por el momento no estás en posibilad  de hacer una aportación económica a este proyecto? No te preocupes, estoy más que agradecido por tomarte el tiempo para leer hasta aquí. Es un honor que te interese mi trabajo y si tienes la oportunidad de pasar la voz sobre el mismo, será un apoyo enorme. Además te invito a seguir en contacto y ver qué está pasando por aquí.

Te agradeceré infinitamente si eres tan amable de pasar la voz sobre este proyecto y si puedes comparte la liga en tus redes sociales.

Seguimos en contacto.

 

You don't take a photograph, you make it.
Ansel Adams

 

My name is Ricardo Alvarez, I am a photographer with over 20 years of experience  in the fill of artistic creation and occasionally as a sports photographer.
I combine my image passion with a taste for teaching: I´ve been a  language teacher and photography professor for over 15 years.

There are two mainly ways how  I produce  my photos , one of them implies to create the scenery so I can include the elements that I have inside my mind, the other way, is going out and search for the images that have something in common so they can be part of a series.


There for here is m request. I feel like my production has stagnated a bit, I want to achieve better results, I want  a  more detailed and polished work , in order to achieve that , having  a good quality printer at my disposal (not having to go back and forth to the camera store ) would make a big difference.


Despitethe fact that I  prefer digital format, I  firmly believe that all that Ansel Adams says  and suggests  about  the printing process  still remain valid and therefore I like to follow his advice (The Print  still a classic reference for photographers) so to  have the complete control of the process is important to get the best results.


Would you like to help a concerned  photographer  in  the quality and details to take the next step ? Would you like to be a part of the improvement of  my  images ? Keep on  readingn, it will already be a big step forward and, if you can, feel free to contribute to my cause.

Meet the lady of my dreams

Epson Stylus ® Photo R3000, I want this printer for its high quality and ease of use, it's easy to work with cotton papers and other textures that dramatically improve the result.

But now, the printer is available from $ 640 what about the rest? Welcome to the world of NAFTA, here in Mexico  this printer have a cost close to 15 thousand pesos , something like $ 1.200 dollars ... after  taxes and the cost of having services  in the country ... sad really ...
The rest of the money I would use it to buy  cotton paper. 25 shetets of  13 x 19  inches is about 1800 pesos (varies depending on the brands you can get), about $ 150 dollars.

What I offer:

1. My deepest and sincere thanks,
2. My dedication to encouraging more people to get to know what is a creative process, how a piece with artistic pretensions is born. I believe that art has nothing to do with the price of a work, but to its content, the relationship with the audience and with the whole creation process and its "history" of life, that's what to me makes art fascinating and am willing to share with anyone who is willing to listen. In the end, again quoating Adams: "There are always two people in every picture: the photographer and the viewe".
3. Share with you some of what I've learned as a photographer, I will create a blog aimed tobeginners and people with low budget, but with love and interest in photography. (Tips on finding the ideal camera, better use of your computer and make basic adjustments to your images, even if there's interest, to share my views on the work of artists that I admire the lens, both the old guard and contemporary ).
4. Finally, what most excites us who live for this, after a certain amount (see the list of benefits) will be in position to send a print of my work, with most of the illusions of the enjoyments and become into something valuable for you.

Raising this project excites me because on one hand help me achieve a breakthrough in my career, in my life plan and secondly, what excites me about how I will establish more contact with people, get feedback, feedback about what I do and the process I follow, believe in art advocated by this and want to go this route. I invite you to participate.

What if you have no money?
What if you can not make a financial contribution to this project? Do not worry, I'm more than grateful for taking the time to read this far. I’m  honored that you are interested in my work and if you have the opportunity to spread the word on it, will be a huge support. Also I invite you to keep in touch and see what's going on around here.
Thank you infinitely if you please spread the word about this project and if you can share the league in your social networks.
We keep in touch.
story_txt:
English version down below
 
You don't take a photograph, you make it.Ansel Adams
 
Mi nombre es Ricardo Álvarez, soy un fotógrafo con más de 20 años de trabajo principalmente en el área de la creación artística y ocasionalmente como fotógrafo deportivo.
Combino mi pasión por la imagen con el gusto por dar clases, soy, desde hace más de 15 años profesor de lengua y también de fotografía.
Hay dos formas en las que hago fotografías, una implica crear los escenarios e incluir los elementos que tengo en mi cabeza, otra, es salir a buscar las imágenes que tengan algo en común y que puedan formar parte de una serie.
Y aquí entra mi petición. Siento que mi producción se ha estancado un poco, quiero alcanzar mejores resultados, quiero hacer un trabajo más detallado y más pulido y en este proceso contar con una impresora de buena calidad  a mi entera disposición (no tener que ir y venir a la tienda fotográfica) haría una gran diferencia.
A pesar de preferir el formato digital creo firmemente que todo lo que Ansel Adams dice y el cuidado que recomienda en el proceso de la impresión siguen y seguirán siendo válidos y por tanto me gusta seguir sus consejos (obras como The Print sigue siendo un clásico para los fotógrafos) por lo que tener control completo del proceso es importante para conseguir los mejores resultados.
¿Te gustaría ayudar a un fotógrafo preocupado por la calidad y el detalle a dar el siguiente salto?¿Te gustaría ser partícipe del rumbo que tomen mis siguientes colecciones de imágenes? Sigue leyendo, eso será ya un gran avance y si te es posible contribuye con mi causa.
Conozcan a la dama de mis sueños
Epson Stylus® Photo R3000 , me interesa esta impresora por su alta calidad y facilidad de manejo; además es fácil trabajar con papeles de algodón y otras texturas que mejoran de manera dramática el resultado.
Pero ahora bien, la impresora se puede conseguir en 640 dólares ¿y el resto? Bienvenidos al mundo del TLC, esta impresora en México tiene un costo cercano a los 15 mil pesos , algo así como 1,200 dólares… por impuestos y la garantía en el país… triste realidad…
El resto del dinero lo emplearía en comprar papel de algodón cuyo precio en tamaños de 13 pulgadas (paquetes de 25 hojas)  es de aproximadamente 1 800 pesos (varía dependiendo de las marcas que pueda conseguir),  unos 150 dólares.
Qué te ofrezco:
1.  Mi más profundo y sincero agradecimiento,
2.  Mi dedicación a propiciar que más gente conozca qué es un proceso creativo, cómo nace una obra con pretensiones artísticas. Creo que el arte no tiene que ver con el precio de una obras, si no con su contenido, con  su relación con el espectador y con la totalidad del proceso en su creación y su “historia” de vida, eso es lo que para mí hace del arte algo fascinante y estoy dispuesto a compartirlo con todo aquel que esté dispuesto a escuchar. Al final, citando nuevamente a Adams “Siempre hay dos personaes en una fotografía: el fotógrafo y el espectador".
3. Compartir contigo algo de lo que como fotógrafo he aprendido, crearé un blog dirigido a principiantes y a personas con bajo presupuesto, pero con amor e interés por la fotografía.  (Consejos sobre cómo encontrar la cámara ideal, mejorar el uso de tu equipo y realizar ajustes básicos a tus imágenes; incluso, si hay interés; compartir mi visión sobre el trabajo de artistas de la lente que admiro, tanto de la vieja guardia como contemporáneos).
4. Finalmente, y lo que más nos emociona a quienes vivimos para esto, a partir de cierta cantidad (ver la lista de beneficios) estaré en posibilidades de enviarte una impresión de mi trabajo, con la mayor de las ilusiones de que la disfrutes y se convierta en algo valioso para ti.
Plantear este proyecto aquí me emociona pues por un lado me ayudará a lograr un avance en mi carrera, en mi proyecto de vida y por otro, lo que me emociona sobre manera, me permitirá establecer un mayor contacto con la gente, recibir opiniones, retroalimentación sobre lo que hago y sobre el proceso que sigo, creo en el arte que propugna por esto y quiero seguir este camino. Te invito a participar.
¿Y si no tienes dinero?
¿Por el momento no estás en posibilad  de hacer una aportación económica a este proyecto? No te preocupes, estoy más que agradecido por tomarte el tiempo para leer hasta aquí. Es un honor que te interese mi trabajo y si tienes la oportunidad de pasar la voz sobre el mismo, será un apoyo enorme. Además te invito a seguir en contacto y ver qué está pasando por aquí.
Te agradeceré infinitamente si eres tan amable de pasar la voz sobre este proyecto y si puedes comparte la liga en tus redes sociales.
Seguimos en contacto.
 
You don't take a photograph, you make it. Ansel Adams
 
My name is Ricardo Alvarez, I am a photographer with over 20 years of experience  in the fill of artistic creation and occasionally as a sports photographer. I combine my image passion with a taste for teaching: I´ve been a  language teacher and photography professor for over 15 years.
There are two mainly ways how  I produce  my photos , one of them implies to create the scenery so I can include the elements that I have inside my mind, the other way, is going out and search for the images that have something in common so they can be part of a series.

I invite you to participate.

I’m  honored that you are interested in my work and if you have the opportunity to spread the word on it, will be a huge support. Also I invite you to keep in touch and see what's going on around here. Thank you infinitely if you please spread the word about this project and if you can share the league in your social networks. story:
Our Story

Nicole Katherine is the owner and designer for Nicole Katherine Designs. For over seven years she's been creating apparel inspired by her love for 1940's and 1950's Hollywood Glamour. Originally her ideas were a melting pot of inspiration from golden era screen sirens, pin up girls, rockabilly, and that old country western look (think Dale Evans), mixed with her edgy punk rock past. Throughout the past few years her line has evolved from a costumy country western look, to a sophisticated and flirty line, with vintage silhouettes and the same sass you find in my personality.


The Impact

By supporting Nicole Katherine Designs, you'll be doing your part to support job growth in the US and shun the concept of Made In China. You're also saving the world from the faux pas dominated fashion market by supporting an original idea in apparel. Nicole Katherine is anti-fast fashion and celebrates the woman's body by creating apparel suitable for all body types, not hiding the female form under frumpy tshirt knit duds, baby doll blouses and baggy boho style.


Support Nicole Katherine Designs and you'll contribute to the revival of the American dream, and renew hope in prosperity. Nicole Katherine strives to be an inspiration to everyone through her hard work and dedication to her goals. She's a single mom and believes that women can balance both family (plus old fashioned values) and career and still move ahead.


By helping us reach our goal, we'll be able to complete the entire line for Fall/Winter 2011- Spring/Summer 2012. We'll be able to have inventory and eliminate both our wholesale and retail customers' waiting period. This will help us boost customer satisfaction, and increase sales since items will be in stock and available for immediate purchase. In addition, we'll be able to bring down the cost of our garments by about 15-20% since we'll be able to produce more items at once.


Our estimated goal also includes advertisement and marketing expenses. We'd like to update the website and make it more fun, interactive and user friendly. Plus, we want to spread the word by creating a catalog to distribute to boutiques throughout Europe, Australia and the Americas. Furthermore, we would like to be featured in a showroom in LA for a certain period of time, as well as in New York.



What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to complete the full line for Fall/Winter 2011- Spring/Summer 2012. Even if we meet half of our goal this will give us the boost we need to streamline our production and have items created in a timely manner.

By helping Nicole Katherine Designs you'll receive the following:

Donations of $5-$24= Our sincerest of thanks and a credit on our social networking site.

Donations of $25-$75= You'll receive our sincerest of thanks, a credit on our website and social networking site as one of our donors/sponsors and a hair accessory or other item from one of our sponsors.

Donations of $76 and up= A Nicole Katherine Designs tshirt or boy beater (your choice), a credit on our site and social networking site as one of our donors/sponsors, plus we'll add your company's banner and business information (if available) to help you as you've helped us!

In Addition....
Nicole Katherine Designs would like to throw a party during fashion week in September. The location will either be in Missoula, MT or Los Angeles, CA. Depending on where the majority of our sponsors are located. If we have equal sponsors in the Northwest and SoCal region we'll make arrangements to accomodate everyone :) this is TBA.
The party is available for anyone to attend that donated $50 and up. Anyone who donated less than $50 is welcome to attend but will be charged a small cover fee.

Other Ways You Can Help

Funds are tight? We completely understand! You can also help out by spreading the word to your friends. Or, donate your time when available. You can help us by promoting our line, or donate your talents to assist us with sales, advertising, design room help, ideas, etc.

story:
The Cycle Company

Cycle Co. is more than a company; it is an idea, and a way of viewing and understanding our ever complex and mysterious world. The word ‘Cycle’ is derived from several ideologies.

First, we believe in a closed loop cycle of production where no waste is created through the manufacturing of our products. 

Second, we will reconstitute waste, trash, and debris and convert them into products.

Lastly, we believe that every human being is connected and we are all involved in this cycle of human development. Just as we respond to the cycle of seasons that alter our way of life, we believe we have to respond to the cycle of time. It is time we implement a sustainable cycle in the production and consumption of our products, and we hope to set a primary example of how this can be done through intuitive design.

Today we ask you to help mobilize cycle by investing in our newest invention.

「さいくる」は会社であるとともに思想でもあります。
私たちにとって「職」とは、自分が住みたい環境づくりであると同時に複雑で謎の多い膨大な世界を理解するひとつの手段でもあると思っております。

当社は商品生産において廃棄物を出さない持続可能的な生産サイクルを活用します。
当社は廃棄物やごみなどの使用済み商品及び材料を再利用し、別の機能を持った新商品につくり変えることに尽力します。

環境、回帰、周期という意味を持った「さいくる」という言葉のように、私たち全ての人間は輪のように繋がっています。一つ一つの人間関係と絆を大切にして自然から生まれて、土に還るような商品作りを目指しています。皆で協力しつつ発想力を養える環境、各地域の文化と習慣の尊重、汚染された地球の浄化、きれいで豊かな環境づくり。様々な分野での最先端技術の研究と開発に努め、世界中のお客様のご要望にお応えする魅力あふれる商品・サービスを提供できるよう志します。

漆の木造サングラスをご購入していただくことによって、会社を軌道に乗せる事が可能になります。心に響く何かを感じましたら、ご支援の方、よろしくお願い致します。

MOKU - Urushi Wooden Framed Sunglasses

With 2 and a half years of research and testing, we have finally produced a pair of wooden framed sunglasses with a new aesthetic, shape, and materiality. The Sunglasses come in 2 varnishes. Black Urushi 黒漆 (Left) and Natural Urushi 生漆 (Right).

二年半の研究を積み重ねて完成した漆の木造サングラス。社会にまだ出回っていない素材感と形態。後、自然にやさしく、制作に廃棄物をださない生産さいくるを活用しました。黒漆と生漆：二種類の漆でサングラスを制作いたしました。

The product is a dialogue between the past and the present - tradtion and innovation.
伝統と発明：私たちは古いものと新しいものと両立した世界で生きています。

Urushi ＜漆＞

Urushi, also known as Japanese Lacquer, is a natural material obtained from the urushi tree. When the trunk of tree is cut, it produces a resin to try to repair the wound. This resin is Urushi. A single tree can only produce a few grams of resin each time it is taped. Because it is so hard to obtain, urushi is considered a very valuable material.

漆はウルシの木からとれる天然素材です。幹に傷をつけるとその傷を塞ごうとでてくる樹液が漆です。一本の木から一回に取れる樹液はわずか数グラム。採集にとても難しい漆はとても貴重なものです。

The Sunglasses come in two types of urushi: 生漆 (natural urushi) and 黒漆 (urushi with black pigment).

AIZOME ＜藍染＞

Each sunglasses comes with a small bag made out of an AIZOME ＜藍染め＞ fabric with a WAGARA pattern ＜和柄＞ (Japanese Pattern).

サングラスを守ってあげるための袋は藍染めの生地を使っており、一つ一つ手作りでこだわったつくりになっております。

AIZOME is the Japanese word for Indigo dye. 

The Rolly Polly Case

The case is designed by combining two existing entities. First, a Kakejiku ＜掛け軸＞, a hanging scroll, and second, a rolly polly. When a rolly polly senses danger, it crawls up into a ball protecting itself from the outer world through its hard shell. The case uses the same idea - the case raps around the glasses, protecting the frames from damage.

日本独特の掛け軸の形態と身体を守るために自分を包み込むダンゴムシ：その二つの媒体が融合することによってできたケース。ケースもサングラス本体と同様、漆で仕上げており、竹と綿製のたこ紐を使用したデザインです。

Biomimicry - We look towards nature when we design.

A Personal Touch

We will engrave a name, word, symbol, or logo on to the ear piece of the frames for the first 200 pairs we create through this fund-raising campaign. We can take any image or font and engrave it into the earpiece of your frames.

一番最初にご購入された２００名のお客さんには、お客さん好みの文字、名前、記号またはシンボルを耳当てに彫り込むサービスをさせていただきます。

Maybe for a present, maybe for yourself, or maybe for that special someone.
友達に、自分に、または特別なあのひとに．．．

Lens Option

Our investors have three choices in selecting the color of lens they want. LIGHT - MIDIUM - DARK. Lens are UV cut.

レンズも３種類から選んでいただきます。ライト、ミディアム、ダーク。UVカットのレンズを使用しております。

Materiality

Keep it natural

The lens's are made out of recyclable plastic, and the frames are made 100 percent out of wood. The wood we used is called Tilia Japonica, a light wood that grows locally all over Japan.

レンズはリサイクル可能。メガネは１００％木製。木は日本列島に生存するシナノキの合板。地球に優しい「もの」と生産工法：それが一番！

We really care about our planet.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is your support, and in return you get a pair of handmade wooden framed sunglasses varnished with Urushi. We hope to be the front runners in this new wave of product design where no waste is produced through the manufacturing and consumption of our products. We use traditional practice in our inventions because the source of that knowledge comes from the relationship between the resources that are prevalent on the land we dwell on and the lifestyle that we choose to live.
サングラスをご購入していただくことによって、サイクルカンパニーを軌道に乗せる事が可能になります。私たちの目的は単純です。物作りを通して、地球をきれいにして行く事です。伝統の知恵を活かし、革新的な発想とその時代にあった人材を育てる環境。農業をベースにした町づくり。そういうヴィジョンを胸に前進していきたい気持ちでいます。
 
Please help us, in mobilizing cycle - so we can start reconstituting waste in making beautiful products.

PERKS

$ 29 - Natural Urushi Moku Key Holder (comes with metal chain)　
漆の木造キーホルダー（金具付き）

直径40mm　40mm in Diameter

$290 - Natural Urushi Sunglasses + Case　生漆サングラス＋ケース
$190 - Natural Urushi Sunglasses　生漆サングラス

$290 - Black Urushi Sunglasses + Case　黒漆サングラス＋ケース
$190 - Black Urushi Sunglasses　黒漆サングラス

Warranty

For the first 200 pairs, I (Sheyen Ikeda) will fix your glasses as long as I am alive. However, shipping and material cost is seperate (Depending on the severity of the damage a maintenance fee may also be added).

一番最初にご購入していただいた２００名のお客様には私自身（池田師援）が生涯をかけて貴方のサングラスの保証とメンテを約束します。素材と送料は実費でお願いします。（損害の度合いによって、メンテ料もとらせていただく場合もありますのでご了承ください。）

Questions and Comments

Please feel free to email us at info@cycle-co.jp
Please email us with the details of your glasses (varnishi, lens, engraving) once you made a purchase.
もし、質問やご不明な点がありましたらinfo@cycle-co.jpまでお問いあわせください。
ご購入された際、詳細情報（漆の種類、レンズのカラー、刻印のデータ）を上記のメールアドまでご送信ください。
 
よろしくお願いします。
story_txt:
The Cycle Company

Cycle Co. is more than a company; it is an idea, and a way of viewing and understanding our ever complex and mysterious world. The word ‘Cycle’ is derived from several ideologies. First, we believe in a closed loop cycle of production where no waste is created through the manufacturing of our products.  Second, we will reconstitute waste, trash, and debris and convert them into products. Lastly, we believe that every human being is connected and we are all involved in this cycle of human development. Just as we respond to the cycle of seasons that alter our way of life, we believe we have to respond to the cycle of time. It is time we implement a sustainable cycle in the production and consumption of our products, and we hope to set a primary example of how this can be done through intuitive design.
Today we ask you to help mobilize cycle by investing in our newest invention.
「さいくる」は会社であるとともに思想でもあります。 私たちにとって「職」とは、自分が住みたい環境づくりであると同時に複雑で謎の多い膨大な世界を理解するひとつの手段でもあると思っております。
当社は商品生産において廃棄物を出さない持続可能的な生産サイクルを活用します。  当社は廃棄物やごみなどの使用済み商品及び材料を再利用し、別の機能を持った新商品につくり変えることに尽力します。
環境、回帰、周期という意味を持った「さいくる」という言葉のように、私たち全ての人間は輪のように繋がっています。一つ一つの人間関係と絆を大切にして自然から生まれて、土に還るような商品作りを目指しています。皆で協力しつつ発想力を養える環境、各地域の文化と習慣の尊重、汚染された地球の浄化、きれいで豊かな環境づくり。様々な分野での最先端技術の研究と開発に努め、世界中のお客様のご要望にお応えする魅力あふれる商品・サービスを提供できるよう志します。
漆の木造サングラスをご購入していただくことによって、会社を軌道に乗せる事が可能になります。心に響く何かを感じましたら、ご支援の方、よろしくお願い致します。
MOKU - Urushi Wooden Framed Sunglasses
With 2 and a half years of research and testing, we have finally produced a pair of wooden framed sunglasses with a new aesthetic, shape, and materiality. The Sunglasses come in 2 varnishes. Black Urushi 黒漆 (Left) and Natural Urushi 生漆 (Right).
二年半の研究を積み重ねて完成した漆の木造サングラス。社会にまだ出回っていない素材感と形態。後、自然にやさしく、制作に廃棄物をださない生産さいくるを活用しました。黒漆と生漆：二種類の漆でサングラスを制作いたしました。

The product is a dialogue between the past and the present - tradtion and innovation.伝統と発明：私たちは古いものと新しいものと両立した世界で生きています。
Urushi ＜漆＞
Urushi, also known as Japanese Lacquer, is a natural material obtained from the urushi tree. When the trunk of tree is cut, it produces a resin to try to repair the wound. This resin is Urushi. A single tree can only produce a few grams of resin each time it is taped. Because it is so hard to obtain, urushi is considered a very valuable material.


漆はウルシの木からとれる天然素材です。幹に傷をつけるとその傷を塞ごうとでてくる樹液が漆です。一本の木から一回に取れる樹液はわずか数グラム。採集にとても難しい漆はとても貴重なものです。

The Sunglasses come in two types of urushi: 生漆 (natural urushi) and 黒漆 (urushi with black pigment).
AIZOME ＜藍染＞
Each sunglasses comes with a small bag made out of an AIZOME ＜藍染め＞ fabric with a WAGARA pattern ＜和柄＞ (Japanese Pattern).
サングラスを守ってあげるための袋は藍染めの生地を使っており、一つ一つ手作りでこだわったつくりになっております。

AIZOME is the Japanese word for Indigo dye. 
The Rolly Polly Case

The case is designed by combining two existing entities. First, a Kakejiku ＜掛け軸＞, a hanging scroll, and second, a rolly polly. When a rolly polly senses danger, it crawls up into a ball protecting itself from the outer world through its hard shell. The case uses the same idea - the case raps around the glasses, protecting the frames from damage.
日本独特の掛け軸の形態と身体を守るために自分を包み込むダンゴムシ：その二つの媒体が融合することによってできたケース。ケースもサングラス本体と同様、漆で仕上げており、竹と綿製のたこ紐を使用したデザインです。

Biomimicry - We look towards nature when we design.
A Personal Touch
We will engrave a name, word, symbol, or logo on to the ear piece of the frames for the first 200 pairs we create through this fund-raising campaign. We can take any image or font and engrave it into the earpiece of your frames.
一番最初にご購入された２００名のお客さんには、お客さん好みの文字、名前、記号またはシンボルを耳当てに彫り込むサービスをさせていただきます。

Maybe for a present, maybe for yourself, or maybe for that special someone.友達に、自分に、または特別なあのひとに．．．
Lens Option
Our investors have three choices in selecting the color of lens they want. LIGHT - MIDIUM - DARK. Lens are UV cut.
レンズも３種類から選んでいただきます。ライト、ミディアム、ダーク。UVカットのレンズを使用しております。

Materiality

Keep it natural
The lens's are made out of recyclable plastic, and the frames are made 100 percent out of wood. The wood we used is called Tilia Japonica, a light wood that grows locally all over Japan.
レンズはリサイクル可能。メガネは１００％木製。木は日本列島に生存するシナノキの合板。地球に優しい「もの」と生産工法：それが一番！

We really care about our planet.


What We Need & What You Get
What we need is your support, and in return you get a pair of handmade wooden framed sunglasses varnished with Urushi. We hope to be the front runners in this new wave of product design where no waste is produced through the manufacturing and consumption of our products. We use traditional practice in our inventions because the source of that knowledge comes from the relationship between the resources that are prevalent on the land we dwell on and the lifestyle that we choose to live.
サングラスをご購入していただくことによって、サイクルカンパニーを軌道に乗せる事が可能になります。私たちの目的は単純です。物作りを通して、地球をきれいにして行く事です。伝統の知恵を活かし、革新的な発想とその時代にあった人材を育てる環境。農業をベースにした町づくり。そういうヴィジョンを胸に前進していきたい気持ちでいます。
 
Please help us, in mobilizing cycle - so we can start reconstituting waste in making beautiful products.

PERKS

$ 29 - Natural Urushi Moku Key Holder (comes with metal chain)　漆の木造キーホルダー（金具付き）

直径40mm　40mm in Diameter
$290 - Natural Urushi Sunglasses + Case　生漆サングラス＋ケース$190 - Natural Urushi Sunglasses　生漆サングラス

$290 - Black Urushi Sunglasses + Case　黒漆サングラス＋ケース$190 - Black Urushi Sunglasses　黒漆サングラス




Warranty
For the first 200 pairs, I (Sheyen Ikeda) will fix your glasses as long as I am alive. However, shipping and material cost is seperate (Depending on the severity of the damage a maintenance fee may also be added).
一番最初にご購入していただいた２００名のお客様には私自身（池田師援）が生涯をかけて貴方のサングラスの保証とメンテを約束します。素材と送料は実費でお願いします。（損害の度合いによって、メンテ料もとらせていただく場合もありますのでご了承ください。）
Questions and Comments
Please feel free to email us at info@cycle-co.jp

Please email us with the details of your glasses (varnishi, lens, engraving) once you made a purchase.
もし、質問やご不明な点がありましたらinfo@cycle-co.jpまでお問いあわせください。
ご購入された際、詳細情報（漆の種類、レンズのカラー、刻印のデータ）を上記のメールアドまでご送信ください。
 
よろしくお願いします。

story:
Kerorek – frogs,  bags and rock'n'roll

I wanted to create a brand for high-quality everyday bags with genuine attitude. Inspired by the amazing rocker frogs and the simplicity and convenience of a drawstring bag I am happy to present the first Kerorek bag design! A kick-ass drawstring backpack with focus on high quality, usability and attitude!

Kerorek was initially an independent project of mine but I have received a lot of support, encouragement and help from my friends and colleagues. Without them and my team I would have never been able to take it this far.

And now I'm asking you guys to help us to take the next big step!

Thank you!

Designer, Milla Niskakoski

 

 

 

Design and Materials

Kerorek takes the classic construction of a drawstring bag to the next level. The effortless closing and opening method, minimalistic design with shoulder paddings and durable and high-quality materials make the KEROREK bag an awesome and convenient everyday bag. The size of the bag is designed to look great whether you are packing it full for a weekend trip or carrying just a few things.

Besides the big main compartment, the bag has a small quick-access front pocket and a full size padded slim pocket inside. The inside pocket fits laptops or tablets up to 15 inches.

Kerorek bags will be available in two lines: Exclusive leather line and light canvas line. The leather bag will be available in brown genuine goat leather, and the canvas bags will be available in PU-coated white and black canvas.

The minimalistic design means you don't get anything unnecessary, but instead a quality bag that is convenient and comfortable while still being surprisingly attractive.

 

Leather

 

White canvas

 

Black canvas

 

 

Features

  • Shoulder pads. Easily adjustable shoulder pads for great comfort. 
  • ​3 compartments. In addition to the big main compartment, the Kerorek bags are equipped with a fast-access front pocket and a padded slim pocket inside the bag.
  • Adjustable straps. The length of the shoulder straps can be easily adjusted to your size and taste.
  • Keyring. You can hang items such as water bottles or accessories to the metallic keyring outside the bag.
  • Zippers. We use only Japanese high quality YKK products so the zippers will last just as long as the materials.

 

 

 

Stretch goals

200 orders - With this many orders, we can exceed the minimum order quantity and have the cotton liner printed with our Kerorek frog pattern.  For less than 200 bags we will use the forest themed stock fabric, which is still pretty cool.

400 orders - We will custom make awesome metal zipper pullers with our own design!

 

Size

The Kerorek bags are sized significantly larger than normal drawstring bags, which makes them great as backpacks. The straps are easily adjustable to fit your size and taste!

 

 

Custom liner print design (stretch goal)

 

 

 

The frogs

Kerorek's totem animal is the Asian Horned frog. These frogs blew my mind with their awesomeness when I saw them while traveling in Malaysia. The unspoken rock'n'roll attitude of the frogs took me back to my teenage years as a colorful metalhead. It reminded me that, as grownups, no matter where and what we end up doing in life, we should not forget the rebellious and free spirit that was once everything to us. It is in that spirit I create the first and all the future designs of Kerorek! Croak'n'Roll!

 

Asian Horned Frogs

 

Kerorek leather patch (Canvas bags will have a rubber patch)

 

The perks!

 

OBS: If you cannot find the right perk for you, feel free to message us! We can bundle together a selection of bags and ship in the same package, saving both trouble and money!

 

The leather bag

The Kerorek leather bag is made of quality goat leather, and each bag will have its own individual texture and character as all leather does. Save $100 from the expected resale price ($249) and get it for our Indiegogo-only discounted pre-sale price $149! 

 

 

 

The canvas bags

The Kerorek canvas bag is made of strong and light drizzle-proof coated canvas from Korea, and instead has a rubber patch to make a proper vegan option. Save $20 off the expected resale price ($69) and get it for our Indiegogo-only discounted pre-sale price $49! 

 

 

White

 

 

Black

 

 

NOTICE! All the bags in the campaign pictures and video are handmade prototypes. When moving to high-end production some minor details (such as some metal parts, rope quality etc) will be upgraded. Therefore the final product will be slightly different from what seen above, but still just as awesome!

 

Our plan, goals and schedule

Over the last few years and piles of prototypes we have perfected the design and sourced the suitable materials and manufacturers. Finally we have everything ready for the manufacturing!

But this is where we need help from you guys! By pre-ordering the KEROREK bag you can help us to reach our goal and the minimum orders we need to produce professionally. The pre-order campaign enables us to sell the bags directly to you, without middlemen, so we are happy to be able to sell it with great discounts!

Take part of the journey of Kerorek and let's make it happen!

 

Schedule

 

 

The Designer

I'm a Finnish product designer living and working in Korea. I moved to Korea to do my masters studies in Product Design and I ended up working as a bag designer for the leading table tennis company in Korea for a few years. I gained precious experience not only about the design work itself, but about materials, manufacturing and branding. Now together with my two colleagues we are preparing on establishing our own design company in Korea.
 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Please also remember that this is a crowdfunding campaign for a product that is not yet produced, and as with all projects there can be bumps along the road even if we are successfully funded.

We have previous experience from bag design and manufacturing, also in Korea, and believe our schedule is well-planned and accounts for some unforeseen circumstances. However, delays and challenges may occur, and we will work through them and update our backers regularly on our progress.

We would like to emphasize that the bag design is done and no further development is needed to make it realizable. What remains is to gather pre-orders and funding, and then confirming production samples with producers we have already located and visited. Please see the schedule for more details and when to expect your bag!

 

The Team

We are a team of three designers from Finland, Norway and Korea, working together in Seoul. Feel free to contact us with any questions, comments or inquiries at milla@kerorek.com!

 Milla Niskakoski - Founder, designer

 Erlend Storsul Opdahl - Designer

 

 Jo Shua - Production manager

 

 

 

 


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
CROAK & ROLL!

 

Special thanks to Tony Holmsten for the amazing frog band illustration and Anastasi Laha and Ben Kenobi for the modelling and mental support! :)

 

Regularly asked questions

 

What is billing postal code?

I placed my order and proceeding to the credit card payment. In addition to the address the page asked me to fill in a billing postal-code. My country doesn't use such code, so what should I write there? If you are placing an order from a country that doesn't use billing postal codes, such as Finland, you can just type in the ZIP-code of your home town.

Suomeksi: Mikä on billing postal code ja mitä siihen pitäisi laittaa? 
Tuo postal code ei meillä Suomessa ole käytössä. Sen tilalle voit jättää ihan vaan oman paikkakuntasi postinumeron.

story:
Chi è dellimellow?

Se ti sei fatto questa domanda qualcosa non va; io sono il più grande vlogger italiano e il più grande youtuber d'Abruzzo, se non mi conosci non sono io che sono poco famoso ma sei tu ad essere poco attento.

Come mai la campagna indiegogo?

Questa campagna nasce dal fatto che in molti non hanno i vestiti e invece di girare nudi vorrebbero essere ammantati di grandezza, l'unico modo che ho per trasferirne un po' della mia (che è illimitata) è creare t-shirt che poi 100 fortunati potranno indossare.

Perchè dovrei contribuire alla campagna?

Perchè se contribuirai alla campagna non ti aggiungerò al mio profilo privato (quello è gratis) ma riceverai come ringraziamento una maglietta.
Ho pensato di creare 4 tipi di ringraziamenti:
  1. Con 5 euro non solo sarai un cagnaccio certificato ma se ordinerai la maglia quando sarà pronta le spese di spedizione saranno a mio carico.
  2. Se donerai 10 euro quando avrò raggiunto l'obiettivo dei 500 euro e avrò realizzato le magliette dovrai solo pagare le spese di spedizione per riceverne una (spese sono circa di 5 euro.
  3. Invece se donerai 15 euro appena avrò realizzato le t-shirt te le mando a casa e tu non dovrai fare un cazzo, solo darmi l'indirizzo.
  4. Se donerai 20 euro non solo avrai tutto quello che hai letto prima ma riceverai in anteprima il primo numero della mia rivista "The Daily Mellow".
  5. NULLA VI VIETA DI DARMI DI PIù NON FATE I TIRCHI

Cosa ci farò con i tuoi soldi?

La verità è che li spenderò in arrosticini, ma siccome non credo mi dareste mezzo euro sapendolo vi racconterò una balla.

 - 360 euro serviranno alla realizzazione delle magliette, 100 t-shirt costano 290 euro + iva e un'altra cosa che non ricordo si arriva a 360 euro.

- 100 euro mi servono per pagare il grafico perchè vorrei fare un'immagine figa

- 40 euro credo siano più o meno le commissioni che se ne andranno tra indiegogo e paypal.

Ecco il sito dove verificare il preventivo delle magliette: http://www.pubblicarrello.com/uomo-tshirt-manic...
